segment.source: Learn how your app can recognize progress and completion reported by a background task.
segment.target: Learn how your app can recognize progress and completion reported by a background task.

segment.source: Background tasks are decoupled from the app, and they run separately, but background task progress and completion can be monitored by app code.
segment.target: Background tasks are decoupled from the app, and they run separately, but background task progress and completion can be monitored by app code.

segment.source: To make this happen, the app subscribes to events from the background task(s) it has registered with the system.
segment.target: To make this happen, the app subscribes to events from the background task(s) it has registered with the system.

segment.source: This topic assumes that you have an app that registers background tasks.
segment.target: This topic assumes that you have an app that registers background tasks.

segment.source: When the app registers a background task for the first time, it should register to receive progress and completion updates for it, in case the task runs while the app is still active in the foreground.
segment.target: When the app registers a background task for the first time, it should register to receive progress and completion updates for it, in case the task runs while the app is still active in the foreground.

segment.source: For example, the background task sample calls the following function on each background task that it registers:
segment.target: For example, the background task sample calls the following function on each background task that it registers:

segment.source: ```cpp void SampleBackgroundTask::AttachProgressAndCompletedHandlers(IBackgroundTaskRegistration^ task) { auto progress = this { auto progress = "Progress: " + args->Progress + "%"; BackgroundTaskSample::SampleBackgroundTaskProgress = progress; UpdateUI(); };
segment.target: ```cpp void SampleBackgroundTask::AttachProgressAndCompletedHandlers(IBackgroundTaskRegistration^ task) { auto progress = this { auto progress = "Progress: " + args->Progress + "%"; BackgroundTaskSample::SampleBackgroundTaskProgress = progress; UpdateUI(); };

segment.source: When the app launches, or navigates to a new page where background task status is relevant, it should get a list of background tasks currently registered and associate them with the progress and completion event handler functions.
segment.target: When the app launches, or navigates to a new page where background task status is relevant, it should get a list of background tasks currently registered and associate them with the progress and completion event handler functions.

segment.source: The list of background tasks currently registered by the application is kept in the BackgroundTaskRegistration.AllTasks property.
segment.target: The list of background tasks currently registered by the application is kept in the BackgroundTaskRegistration.AllTasks property.

segment.source: For example, the background task sample uses the following code to attach event handlers when the SampleBackgroundTask page is navigated to:
segment.target: For example, the background task sample uses the following code to attach event handlers when the SampleBackgroundTask page is navigated to:

segment.source: ```cs protected override void OnNavigatedTo(NavigationEventArgs e) { foreach (var task in BackgroundTaskRegistration.AllTasks) { if (task.Value.Name == BackgroundTaskSample.SampleBackgroundTaskName) { AttachProgressAndCompletedHandlers(task.Value); BackgroundTaskSample.UpdateBackgroundTaskStatus(BackgroundTaskSample.SampleBackgroundTaskName, true); } }
segment.target: ```cs protected override void OnNavigatedTo(NavigationEventArgs e) { foreach (var task in BackgroundTaskRegistration.AllTasks) { if (task.Value.Name == BackgroundTaskSample.SampleBackgroundTaskName) { AttachProgressAndCompletedHandlers(task.Value); BackgroundTaskSample.UpdateBackgroundTaskStatus(BackgroundTaskSample.SampleBackgroundTaskName, true); } }
